author: .fjl
content: We can migrate to another signature scheme in discv5 / ENR as well, just need to pick one.

author: .fjl
content: For ENRs, a big challenge is that the definition of ENR kind of relies on signatures and pubkeys being small

author: .fjl
content: In each ENR, we pack the public key and a signature made by the key

author: .fjl
content: This will not work with PQ signature schemes because they are usully much larger than in ECDSA

author: .fjl
content: We need to either implement some kind of 'detached signature' solution in the protocol, or find an alternative with smaller signatures, or give up on signed records.

author: .fjl
content: CSIDH looks promising for discv5: https://csidh.isogeny.org/index.html
